name: places/ChIJM2CPc61ZwokRLScrFck5gHI
formattedAddress: 320 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 320 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018-3204, USA

originalText.text:
Horrible Experience. Booked a reservation via the application Spothero. Dropping off the car was easy, however picking it up, they wanted to charge an additional $10. When I showed them the reservation and that I paid already, they said that the price was $60 instead of $50. They literally had me waiting there, while the guy in the counter was doing nothing.  A customer behind me had the exact same problem, so I couldn't have been the first one throughout the entire day. After wasting approx 15 minutes doing nothing, he finally decides to make a phone call.

At that point another gentleman came and said not to worry. He explained that the app pricing was not updated properly and finally gave us our keys to the car. The whole thing was very unnecessary for $10, so we do not plan on revisiting.

originalText.text: Great convenient and secure parking facility in NYC. Easy in/out with professional lot attendants. Serves the Emerald Green condo residents so higher standard and completely enclosed. Near theater district and Times Square. Good neighborhood. Exit on 37th for immediate Lincoln Tunnel access. Tip them $20 when you park and they will keep your car on top near desk. My go-to NYC day-trip parking for years

originalText.text: Parking is expensive in the city. They all are. We parked here to go walk around and go to the tree lighting but just after I handed over the keys and the guy drove away I realized that I left $400 in cash in the center console. I thought maybe I should say I forgot something but I didn't want to be a bother so I figured oh well If it gets stolen I'll raise a stink and leave a bad review. We got back 5 hours later and it was $50 charge and sure enough I open the center console and the money was still sitting there. Gave the guy a $5 tip.

originalText.text: Avoid this service if parking is necessary; the customer service is extremely poor. I reserved parking through Park a Spot, providing car details, and they  categorized my car as regular-sized car . Despite booking through a third party, the staff charged an extra $10 without telling it’s an oversized car even though the car is an Suv. The employees' language was also highly inappropriate.

originalText.text: DON'T use the Emerald Green garage. They randomly apply fees and cost on a whim rather than stick to their price list printed everywhere and the price the valet told me when parking.  $65+10 for "oversized", standard pickup truck. Ended up paying $90 for overnight parking. Not a huge deal, but honor your prices. This Garage takes advantage of tourists, knowing they have no choice but to pay the inflated price to get their vehicle.
